messages.messageBody:
I also have a son who is not circed. (Raised Jewish)
My husband didn't have a choice about it. Its not his penis and I wasn't
going to allow anyone to hurt my child again.
Elissa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2594
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/1/2002 10:46:41 AM Central Standard Time, sjogy@aol.com ... Thus the lack of objectivity.  ;) ... Obviously, that is an angle I failed to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/1/2002 10:46:41 AM Central Standard Time, sjogy@...
writes:

> I deferred to Craig about the ultimate decision because I don't have a
> penis.
>
Thus the lack of objectivity. ;)

> First we talked about all the issues, including the one about me and my kids
>
> being Jewish.

Obviously, that is an angle I failed to consider in my original post.

I just couldn't mutilate my children.

Tuck

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2594
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/1/02 8:27:19 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/1/02 8:27:19 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
writes:

<< I don't understand why any woman would defer the circ issue to the father.

Men aren't exactly objective about it. >>

I deferred to Craig about the ultimate decision because I don't have a penis.

First we talked about all the issues, including the one about me and my kids
being Jewish. I was generally against circ. but felt I could be persuaded by
Craig. However, he was totally against it himself. So, as if we weren't out
of the box enough, we have a Jewish boy who is not circumcized! (I know some
folks will argue if this is even possible, but I'm not interested in talking
about that in this forum).

Paula
